text:
e="preserve">Anthony Arthur Crampton "Tony" Blue (4 February 1936 – 1 October 2020) was an Australian middle-distance runner. He competed in the 800 metres at the 1960 Summer Olympics and the 1964 Summer Olympics.
Blue won a bronze medal in the 880 yards at the 1962 British Empire and Commonwealth Games.
Blue died on 1 October 2020 at the age of 84.
